description:
**Fix Overview**:

To resolve the Windows Network Address Translation (NAT) denial of service vulnerability (CVE-2024-21343):

1. Identify the relevant KB article for your version of Windows from the list below:
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5034765](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034765)
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5034765](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034765)
   - Windows 11 Version 21H2: [KB5034766](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034766)
   - Windows 10 for x64-based Systems: [KB5034774](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034774)
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2: [KB5034763](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034763)
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2: [KB5034763](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034763)

2. Download the update from the provided link based on the build of your system.
3. Install the update and follow on-screen instructions.
4. Restart your system to apply the changes.

**Details**:
- This update addresses a specific denial of service vulnerability that could allow an attacker to disrupt network address translations.
- Ensure you are running the appropriate version of Windows before proceeding with the update installation.
- Backup critical data to prevent any potential loss during the update process.
